article_text:
In Congress: 2016 Appropriations, Highway Bill

Law360, New York (November 15, 2015, 10:51 PM ET) -- After a short respite to observe Veterans Day, members return to Capitol Hill Monday with fiscal year 2016 appropriations on the agenda and a looming highway authorization deadline on the calendar.



Negotiations over a long-term federal highway and infrastructure bill are headed into the final phase of congressional negotiation. Congress faces a Friday deadline to complete work on the highway and infrastructure legislation because the current extension expires on Nov. 20 at midnight. Even though members were largely back in their districts last week, staff for...

To view the full article, register now.

article_metadata.description: With Congress facing a Nov. 20 deadline to complete work on the highway and infrastructure legislation, negotiations are headed into the final phase this week. Appropriations for 2016 will also be on the agenda, even though the fiscal year is already well underway, say Richard Hertling and Kaitlyn McClure of Covington & Burling LLP.

og.title: In Congress: 2016 Appropriations, Highway Bill - Law360
